cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 145 mi SE of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west along the north coast of Cuba, forecast to turn northwest tonight and then north-northwest on Sunday, taking the center across the Florida Keys and up the southwest Florida coast before curving inland across south-central Georgia and the southeastern United States.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Keys and then the southwest coast of Florida

weather_observation.under_watch: Hurricane Watch (also under Storm Surge Watch)
weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch north of Fernandina Beach, FL to Edisto Beach, SC; Storm Surge Watch north of the Volusia/Brevard County line, FL to Isle of Palms, SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Fernandina Beach, FL southward around the Florida peninsula to the Aucilla River; Florida Keys (Port of Brunswick is just north of the warning limit)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula, Georgia and South Carolina coasts are expected to receive tropical-storm to hurricane-force winds, heavy rain and storm surge
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (81%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds with a 35% chance of 50-kt winds between Monday and early Tuesday; gusts could exceed 60 mph on exposed areas.
weather_observation.storm_surge: NHC surge forecast calls for 4–6 ft of inundation above ground for the Georgia coast from Fernandina Beach, FL to Isle of Palms, SC, which includes Brunswick.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–15 inches of rain possible across southeast Georgia with isolated amounts up to 20 inches, producing flash-flood risk around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor coastal flooding at high tide, dangerous surf/rip currents, possible embedded tornadoes in outer rain-bands, prolonged power outages and debris hazards that will hamper port operations.
